title: CFIRSTNET: Comprehensive Features for Static IR Drop Estimation with Neural Network
author: Yu-Tung Liu (National Yang Ming Chiao Tung University), Shao-Yu Wu (National Yang Ming Chiao Tung University), Yu-Hao Cheng (National Yang Ming Chiao Tung University), Hung-Ming Chen (National Yang Ming Chiao Tung University), ..., Haohe Liu (N/A)
background: Static IR drop estimation evaluates voltage drops across power delivery networks in circuit designs, essential for ensuring reliability and performance in integrated circuits.
contribution: This paper introduces CFIRSTNET, a convolutional neural network model that combines image-based and netlist-based features to enhance the estimation accuracy of static IR drops in integrated circuit designs.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods struggle with computational efficiency and estimation accuracy, often requiring time-consuming simulations or focusing solely on specific circuit features.
technical_comparison.novelty: CFIRSTNET uniquely integrates both image-based and netlist-based features in its architecture, achieving a significant speedup and lower error rates compared to traditional estimation methods.

key_innovation: The integration of both image-based and netlist-based data allows the model to leverage spatial information and electrical characteristics simultaneously, improving the robustness of predictions.
real_world_impact: This method could streamline the circuit design process by reducing the time spent on IR drop estimation, leading to faster and more reliable product development in the semiconductor industry.
limitations: The paper does not explicitly mention significant limitations, though it could face challenges with scaling to extremely complex circuits.

new_terms.IR drop: **IR drop** refers to the voltage drop that occurs when current flows through the resistance of a wire, which can result in insufficient voltage supplied to electronic components causing potential malfunctions.
